com.zensols.clojure.log

Class ClojureAppender

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.logging.log4j.core.AbstractLifeCycle
      • org.apache.logging.log4j.core.filter.AbstractFilterable
        • org.apache.logging.log4j.core.appender.AbstractAppender
          • com.zensols.clojure.log.ClojureAppender
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, org.apache.logging.log4j.core.Appender, org.apache.logging.log4j.core.filter.Filterable, org.apache.logging.log4j.core.LifeCycle

    @Plugin(name="Clojure",
        category="Core",
        elementType="appender",
        printObject=true)
public class ClojureAppender
extends org.apache.logging.log4j.core.appender.AbstractAppender

    The Log4j2 appender class that dumps log events to the grabbed REPL PrintWriter (*out* symbol) class. Log4j2 only uses one instance of this class, so once setWriter(PrintWriter) is called, it forwards the log events only to this writer instance.

    You can also call this class with the Clojure println function (or any function that takes a single string argument), which will be invoked for each incoming log event from Log4j2 if set.

    To use this class, either call setWriter(java.io.PrintWriter) and/or setPrintFn(clojure.lang.IFn).

    To use this class, you have to call it from the REPL.
    Author:
    Paul Landes
    See Also:
    REPL configuration, ClojurePrint, Serialized Form
